details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Games Lab → 01. Cluster 1 → GL-01-C01

results.title: Arthur and Corinne Cantrill interview with Fiona Trigg [excerpt]
results.brief_description:
Arthur and Corinne Cantrill have been making films together since 1960. Initially focusing on documentaries about art they moved on to experimental film in 1969. From 1971 to 2000 they edited and published Cantrills Filmnotes, a journal on film and video art. Their film work and publishing are well-known internationally and have been represented in several film collections.

In this interview with Fiona Trigg, ACMI Exhibitions Assistant Curator, Arthur and Corinne talk about their early days of expanded cinema and their technical and creative processes.

results.title: Visual perception
results.brief_description: Dr. Hadley Cantrill of Princeton University discusses his investigations of the effects of some of our assumptions on what we see. Shows balloons that seem to move when in reality they are being inflated and deflated, or illuminated and darkened.

results.title: The Survivor
results.brief_description: Using animation and archival live action footage (sourced from the Prelinger Archive) this is a story of a lonely astronaut’s survival as he watches the global destruction of Planet Earth from afar.

results.title: Ron the zookeeper
results.brief_description:
Claymation story about Sushi, the last male grey panda and his reluctance to be a sperm donator to save his species from extinction.
WARNING: Contains sex scenes, coarse language and adult themes

results.title: [Hu Shuo's amazing travels]
results.brief_description: Computer animated story about the humble Hu Shuo’s perilous journey through Middle Kingdom in search of the ever-present nature of Da Miao (Miao Miao the Necromancer) and his subsequent encounters with the Fu Bears.
